meanings.definition: A compound derived from ammonia by replacement of hydrogen atoms with one or more carbonyl groups.
meanings.sent1: The scientist synthesized new carbamides in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use carbamides to protect their crops from pests.
meanings.sent3: The carbamides in the fertilizer were feeling nitrogen-rich and ready to help plants grow.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like carbamides in a field of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The smell of carbamides lingered in the air, a sign of progress in the experiment.

meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing the functional group -CONH2.
meanings.sent1: Students learned about carbamides in their organic chemistry class.
meanings.sent2: The pharmaceutical industry often utilizes carbamides in drug development.
meanings.sent3: The carbamides at the party were the life of the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as strong as the bonds holding carbamides together.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of carbamides under the microscope fascinated the young scientist.
